title: How to Make Lemonade Cookies

steps.headline: Fill a large bowl with hot water.
Place the can of frozen lemonade concentrate in the bowl and allow it to thaw while you mix the cookie dough.
Cream together the butter, sugar and lemon zest in a mixing bowl using a handheld mixer or a stand mixer with a paddle attachment.
steps.description: Beat the mixture for about 2 minutes on medium speed or until the mixture is creamy and light yellow

steps.headline: Add the eggs one at a time and beat the mixture for 30 seconds after each addition.
steps.description: Then, beat the mixture for an additional 4 to 5 minutes.

steps.headline: While the wet ingredients are mixing, whisk together the flour, baking soda and kosher salt in a separate mixing bowl.
Measure out 1/2 cup of the thawed lemonade.
steps.description: You will use additional lemonade concentrate later in the recipe, so be sure not to discard the rest.

steps.headline: Pour 1/3 of the flour mixture into the wet ingredients and beat on low speed until just combined.
Add about 1/3 of the lemonade that you measured out and beat the mixture until blended.
Continue adding dry ingredients and lemonade alternately until both are incorporated into the wet ingredients.
Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
steps.description: Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper.

steps.headline: Drop 1 teaspoon of dough onto the baking sheet.
steps.description: Continue placing dough on the baking sheet by the teaspoon until the baking sheet is full. Leave about 1" (2.5 cm) of space around each cookie.

steps.headline: Bake the cookies, checking them after 8 minutes.
steps.description: Remove the cookies from the oven when the edges are starting to brown.

steps.headline: Cool the cookies on the stove for 2 minutes.
Loosen the cookies from the parchment paper with a spatula and place them on wire racks.
Brush the tops of the cookies with lemonade concentrate using a pastry brush.
Sprinkle the tops of the cookies with sugar and allow them to cool completely before serving.

text: Prepare the Dough Fill a large bowl with hot water.  Place the can of frozen lemonade concentrate in the bowl and allow it to thaw while you mix the cookie dough.  Cream together the butter, sugar and lemon zest in a mixing bowl using a handheld mixer or a stand mixer with a paddle attachment. Beat the mixture for about 2 minutes on medium speed or until the mixture is creamy and light yellow Add the eggs one at a time and beat the mixture for 30 seconds after each addition. Then, beat the mixture for an additional 4 to 5 minutes. While the wet ingredients are mixing, whisk together the flour, baking soda and kosher salt in a separate mixing bowl.  Measure out 1/2 cup of the thawed lemonade. You will use additional lemonade concentrate later in the recipe, so be sure not to discard the rest. Pour 1/3 of the flour mixture into the wet ingredients and beat on low speed until just combined.  Add about 1/3 of the lemonade that you measured out and beat the mixture until blended.  Continue adding dry ingredients and lemonade alternately until both are incorporated into the wet ingredients.  Bake the Cookies Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper. Drop 1 teaspoon of dough onto the baking sheet. Continue placing dough on the baking sheet by the teaspoon until the baking sheet is full. Leave about 1" (2.5 cm) of space around each cookie. Bake the cookies, checking them after 8 minutes. Remove the cookies from the oven when the edges are starting to brown. Cool the cookies on the stove for 2 minutes.  Loosen the cookies from the parchment paper with a spatula and place them on wire racks.  Brush the tops of the cookies with lemonade concentrate using a pastry brush.  Sprinkle the tops of the cookies with sugar and allow them to cool completely before serving.  Finished.
